author: Chun Han Wong
title: Indian and Chinese Leaders Vow Better Communication, More Trade
text:
BEIJING—The leaders of China and India pledged to improve communication over military and security matters, an agreement from a quickly arranged summit meant to repair relations after a bitter border standoff and other simmering disputes.
Over a two-day meeting in central China that ended Saturday, Chinese President Xi Jinping and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi also agreed to expand trade and investment as a way to foster friendlier ties between the world’s two most-populous nations, according to official statements from...
